intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subvar. exiguum, commonly known as the slender bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. The plant features a slender, branching stem with alternate, trifoliate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in racemes, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
